Sharing a terminal session with termshare
http://blog.oddbit.com/post/2014-05-21-sharing-a-terminal-session-wit/ 2014-05-21T00:00:00+0000 2014-05-21T00:00:00+0000 Termshare is a tool for sharing your terminal in a browser session. It supports both read-only and read-write sessions, and unlike many other tools it does not require any software installation on the remote side. This makes it tremendously handy for: Streaming terminal demonstrations to a diverse audience, or Sharing a terminal session with someone without needing to much about with ssh, tmux, screen, etc. I’ve successfully used Termshare under both Fedora (19 and 20) and CentOS.
